greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that k^(3^n)*(k^(3^n)-1)+1 is prime.
comment: Numbers of the form k^m*(k^m-1)+1 with m > 0, k > 1 may be primes only if m is 3-smooth, because these numbers are Phi(6,k^m) and cyclotomic factorizations apply to any prime divisors >3. This series is a subset of A205506 with only m=3^n, which is similar to the A153438 series.
example: When k = 7, k^18-k^9+1 is prime. Since this isn't prime for k < 7, a(2) = 7.
mathematica: While[! PrimeQ[k^(3^n)*(k^(3^n) - 1) + 1], k++]; k]; a246120 /@ Range[0, 9] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 15 2014 *)
results.author: _Serge Batalov_, Aug 14 2014
